headline: One of the best company for fast professional growth
pros:
Wolt became a place where I can finally grow professionally within the company rather than looking for that growth in new companies. During first year of being here, I've already been working with 2 big side projects besides my main responsibilities (performance marketing). And I'm quite sure this is only the beginning of even faster development.

The team is just perfect! Always helpful and supportive.
cons: There is nothing I would recommend to change immediately.

headline: A great place to work where trust is giving from day 1

- Good stock compensation program

- Lack of benefits

- Team leads (some) don't seem to know how to help team members to grow their careers

headline: Value driven excellence with broad horizons
pros: Wolt is a youthful and passionate group of people not stuck in hierarchies and labels. The business is scaling like wildfire and there are lots of meaningful technical challenges in various domains where we operate. Teams have a lots of agency and leadership from the CEO onwards is very visible and concrete.
cons: It can get quite hectic, and despite the size of the company, things are very start-up like (by design). Lots of new people can mean a lot of friction when it comes to fitting together the ways of working between new stakeholders.

headline: Great company!
pros: Energy and enthusiasm is something we cant get enough of. The atmosphere is very open and focuses on the well being of everyone
cons: The compensation is on the lower side, but it is a start up and has huge potential to grow.

headline: Not professional
pros:
clothing is better not best.
restaurant people are polite.
customers give respect most of the time.
shift can end anywhere but start should be in HubSpot.
cons:
No respect from support associates.
most of the time they assign wrong address and force you to make delivery to new address again. Some treat you like garbage which is disgusting. they chill in work place barely move from place but all they do is to harass driver in every 20 min of time. sometimes, they put there mistake on poor drivers to save there job and complete the target.

You cannot earn more money because the trick is they exhaust you from the time you start and in the end less orders no bonus.

headline: Work hard, play hard but with a great inclusive environment
pros: Love the people around me, you're trusted and have full ownership without micromanaging. I love the weekly Wolt wide shoutouts, it really shows that all the hard work is appreciated. :)
cons: The only con I see is that having started working at the firm during Covid, I haven't met that many people in person. Hoping for this to be over soon so that we could have fun together face-to-face too.

headline: wolt
pros: good and easy to go with , you can start working at anytime you want, and you get all the support that you need
cons: you are on move all time, and it is hard to find parking place in the city,sometimes you have to park far from the restaurant or the customers place .

headline: Paying is good but it has annoying problems!
pros: You can earn pretty good money within a very flexible working environment.
cons:
-I personally believe, that the support team should be better organized. Because  I wasn't able to get clear answers to my questions.

-My payments have been sometimes wrongly calculated, it was necessary for me to be very careful to check and correct them. 

-They expected from us to work in the worst weather conditions, while the other similar companies decided to offer paid holidays for those days to ensure the safety of their couriers.

- When I left the company, the deregistering process was really annoying! They didn't do their legal responsibilities in time.

headline: So far, SO WOLT!
pros:
Great culture! 

Flat structure that makes insightful discussions likely and relatively easy to have. 
Fun informal tone from leaders and that permeates interactions throughout the organization. Many tools for employees to communicate with leaders and provide feedback about their day to day, future outlook, health, relationships and other areas. Relatively simple to interact with colleagues in other departments. 

Many opportunities to grow professionally and try new things.
cons: Communication takes place primarily through Slack and there is relatively little common structure to set up meetings, follow up on assignments/ deliverables, use calendars.

headline: Do not work for them in Hungary
pros:
some of the teams were good with fun atmosphere (not mine unfortunately) 
chance to work in another Wolt country 
great tools to work with 
office location
looks good in your resumé
snacks in the office
cons:
salary is surprisingly low.. very low. 
poor management
chaos
HQ's policy in Finland is great and valuable but the Hungarian team does not follow it, only on paper
racist, sexist colleagues
my first and last payment was incorrect because there is no one with HR or payroll knowledge (which was also surprising in a company this big)
they do call you after working hours and also on weekends (forget your private life if you want to do your job well)
the flow of the information is also very poor - you will not get enough information to do your job
unnecessary meetings about the same thing every week, but without any progress
bad meeting culture: imagine that you have 10 things to discuss and 1 hour to do this. They talk and talk to long and do the brainstorming on the "overall" meeting - which should have been done earlier - and every week you will only get to talk through the first 3 points.

headline: Great culture and great business fundamentals
pros:
Company is trying to build a world-class foundation and culture in engineering and product teams, with things moving in the right direction.
People are mostly mid-senior level with high expertise and competence.
Business and unit economics is very solid, this company can probably outpace a lot of competition in their space.
cons: While everyone is nice and skilled, not everyone shares all of the company values like ambition and ownership

headline: The best place I've worked for
pros:
- High growth company with great prospects
- Awesome product that I'm happy to recommend to anyone, and proud to be a part of the development of
- Really skilled and awesome colleagues to work with and learn from
- Fantastic working atmosphere, where due to us all owning a piece of the company, we aim for the same target
cons: - Some growing pains with high-growth, as is to be expected

headline: One of the most exiting startups in Finland
pros:
I have a long background working for great software consulting companies in Finland and what I've learned is that the project you work on is the most important thing that determines workplace happiness and how much you're learning. Working for a startup or product company, you choose the "project" by choosing the company, and for me the "project" of building a quickly scaling food delivery startup is better than any project I did in almost 10 years as a consultant. I also really like working on a product that I use multiple times per week.

Although we've grown a lot in the 2 years I've worked here, the product team (currently just over 60 people) is still fairly small compared to the everything we build, so each developer and designer gets a lot of responsibility and power. It's  often a surprise to people coming in for interviews how many things we build, the customer facing app is just the tip of the iceberg.

Decisions about the tech stack are left to the teams, but our culture is one where we care more about solving the business problems than playing with esoteric tech - our choices of React in the frontend, Swift & Kotlin for mobile apps, React Native for the courier app and Python + Scala (+ Rust and C++ in some places) in the backend are fairly mainstream - my experience is that playing with crazy tech is something you do when the actual business problem is not exiting enough.

Our operations run in many countries, so we're naturally international. This is also reflected on the product side of things, even though everyone is working at the HQ, we have ~50% of the engineers from somewhere outside Finland. English is the company language and spoken also in informal settings like lunch, if and when there is someone who doesn't speak Finnish at the table.
cons:
Wolt is a quickly growing company and with that come some growth pains - for someone coming from a great consulting company, not everything process will be as smooth as it could be, and sometimes you have to push yourself to see the changes happen. Usually things do work out like I'd like them to, but it won't be handed to you on a silver platter.

The fact that the busiest times for our operations are evenings and weekends means that you get messages on slack outside normal working hours. Nobody is forcing you to answer them, but at I least I have a bad habit of responding to bug reports in the evening once I get the kids to bed
